info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 7:10PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of San Bernardino and Riverside Counties through 800 PM PDT... At 708 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles west of Midland, or 24 miles northeast of Desert Center, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could kick up some blowing dust causing reduced visibility along a strech of Highway 177 and create more difficult handling conditions. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of San Bernardino and Riverside Counties with any runoff unlikely to cause road flooding. This includes CA Route 177 between mile markers 14 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
